pullRequest.body:
This PR introduces a class for categories with explicit choices of binary products and terminal objects, and introduces the associated (Cartesian) symmetric monoidal instance. The primary use of this class is to be able to define internal algebraic objects in categories with chosen finite products, while retaining good definitional properties of the products in question, primarily as a convenience.

We introduce an instance of this new class for the category of types where the binary product is the usual type-theoretic product and the terminal object is `PUnit`. Future work will introduce an instance for other categories, especially the category of affine schemes which should make objects like group schemes more convenient.

NOTE: In some sense this reverses the refactor done in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/3995 but only in the particular case of binary products and terminal objects. Working with (nonexplicit) (co)limits is still the preferred way to work with (co)limits in abstract categories, and instances of `ChosenFiniteProducts` (and other similar classes which may be introduced in the future) should be carefully considered before they are introduced.

---

I would like to see this go in because I am interested in seeing whether it solves problems that we're seeing with monoid objects in the FLT project.
I would like to see this go in because I am interested in seeing whether it solves problems that we're seeing with monoid objects in the FLT project.

Feels a bit like we're coming full circle, having switched away from this approach in https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/3995. I hope that usage of this stays localized enough that it's not as painful this time.

I care more about the category of schemes, or affine schemes, or affine schemes over Spec(R). If you are envisaging your work being helpful for these categories (which are much more interesting than the boring old category of types) then you could mention one or more of them here. If this is future work then it could be added as a TODO.
Will do. Right now the category of types is the only example that's provided.
I added a comment in the module docstring for now.

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
Copyright (c) 2024 Adam Topaz. All rights reserved.
```

We can probably live with this, but I do think that the name is a bit of a lie, because neither does this class give you any way to talk about finite products, nor does it actually imply the existence of a good choice of finite products.

Yes, I agree, but I think the more "correct" name (e.g. "ChosenTerminalObjectsAndBinaryProducts") is too long. I think "ChosenFiniteProducts" is a good compromise, given existing names like "monoidalOfChosenFiniteProducts".

```suggestion
  monoidalOfChosenFiniteProducts terminal product
```
I would prefer the name `hom_ext`, simply because `lift` doesn't actually appear in the statement.
I just noticed that `monoidalOfChosenFiniteProducts` works with `Functor.empty.{v}` while the rest of the API for terminal objects uses `Functor.empty.{0}`. Maybe something to clean up in the future.

I'm not an expert on instances, but I believe that the instances `ChosenFiniteProducts C -> MonoidalCategory C`, `ChosenFiniteProducts C -> SymmetricCategory C` and `ChosenFiniteProducts C -> HasFiniteProducts C` should all get `(priority := 100)` since they always apply.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: chosen finite products in a category
